item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Faces 'Uphill Battle' to Match Inquisition's Launch Sales, Says Analyst
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/dragon-age-the-veilguard-faces-uphill-battle-to-match-inquisitions-launch-sales-says-analyst

BioWare's latest is off to a good, but not great, start.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard launched on October 31, and we've already got a tiny window into how well it's selling. It debuted at No.6 on Circana's report of the top selling games in the US for the full month, just after Metaphor: ReFantazio. But its placement on a single chart doesn't quite tell the full story.

We reached out to analyst Mat Piscatella at Circana following the report to get a little more info on just how well Veilguard was doing, and he offered some context. Though it might look like Dragon Age is being soundly beaten by a number of other debut titles for the month of October, he notes that Dragon Age launched on October 31, and the chart tracks through November 2. So Dragon Age only had three days of sales reflected in the chart, while most other games on it had significantly more.

Additionally, Piscatella pointed out that EA does not provide Steam data for the best-selling titles charts, so while other games (including Metaphor) had Steam digital sales reflected, Dragon Age's numbers are only for PlayStation and Xbox.

"Were Dragon Age: The Veilguard's PC volume included it would have placed higher on the best-selling titles chart â€” perhaps as high as 3rd overall," he says. "Unfortunately, however, digital sales are included in these specific charts only at the discretion of the publisher."

For more info, we asked Piscatella if there was any way to compare The Veilguard's launch sales to its Dragon Age predecessors, but Circana's weekly data only goes back to 2018, so no dice there. However, Piscatella did have some analysis to add about how things were going:

"Just looking at the first days of sales and initial engagement levels via Circana's Player Engagement Tracker, it's been a good - but not great - launch," he said. "Dragon Age: The Veilguard did not reach the launch week sales levels of either Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth or Dragon's Dogma II, and it will be a bit of an uphill battle to reach Inquisition's lifetime sales. But again, it's very early and a lot of the story is left to be told. November will give us a much better read."

Though we don't have sales numbers for Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth, Square Enix has said they did not meet their internal expectations. Meanwhile, Capcom reported that Dragon's Dogma 2 was a success for them, having passed 2.5 million copies sold as of this past April. We do have a bit more comparison context through sales numbers in the UK, courtesy of GamesIndustry.biz. Dragon Age: The Veilguard debuted at No.7 on UK sales charts, but its first week sales were over 18% lower than those of Dragon's Dogma 2 and nearly 21% below those of Final Fantasy 7: Rebirth.

The Art of Dragon Age: The Veilguard - Preview Gallery

We gave The Veilguard a 9/10 in our review, writing that it "refreshes and reinvigorates this storied series with enjoyable action combat, a fantastic cast of companions, and moving character writing." Opinions on it have varied, though, including among our own staff. You can form your own opinion if you haven't yet, as Veilguard is already getting a price drop for Black Friday.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

item.title: Best Gifts for Gamers: Our Favorite Accessories, Games and Merch for Consoles and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/best-gifts-for-gamers

It's that time of year when we find ourselves in need of gift ideas. Gift giving comes naturally for some, but for others, finding the perfect gift can be difficult. Thankfully, shopping for someone who enjoys playing video games is pretty straightforward. You can never go wrong getting them a new controller, a pair of headphones, or, well... more games to play.

IGN staff has assembled like the Avengers to provide great gift recommendations for that special gamer in your life. Whether they are fans of Nintendo, PlayStation, Xbox, PC, or just love gaming in general, we've rounded up the absolute best gifts you can find below this holiday season.

Top Gifts for Gamers

Fallout Lucy's Vault 33 Backpack

As seen in Amazon's Fallout TV series, this replica of Lucy's Vault 33 backpack features a yellow fleece blanket, a 16-inch laptop pocket, and nine additional pockets to keep all of your goodies safe from the Wasteland.

If you're shopping for a general gaming-related gift, the IGN Store is home to gifts from just about any fandom. Amazon Prime's Fallout series is hot off the heels of its fantastic first season, and there are plenty of great gifts based on the show including a functional replica of Lucy's Vault 33 backpack, a Vault 33 hoodie, a 3-piece lithograph poster collection, and more. Beyond the Wasteland, however, are many more great gifts like gaming-inspired cookbooks, vinyl record collections, figurines, and much more below.

More top gaming gifts

Still want more ideas? Scroll through the rest of our top video game gifts you haven't explored yet.

Best Gifts for Nintendo Gamers

Shopping for a Nintendo fan shouldn't be too difficult, as they have some of the most recognizable characters and franchises, such as Mario, The Legend of Zelda, and Donkey Kong, which have been around for decades. IGN Technical Producer Amir Rakib recommends the 8Bitdo Ultimate Bluetooth Controller as it's more comfortable for extended gaming sessions than the standard Joy-Con controllers, and he likes the improved Hall Effect sensor joysticks that eliminate stick drift.

8bitdo Ultimate Bluetooth Controller

The 8bitdo Ultimate Controller works with Nintendo Switch, Steam Deck, and PC via Bluetooth or a 2.4GHz wireless connection and features customizable back buttons, built-in rumble, and a charging dock.

Whether you're picking up a new game like Super Mario Jamboree or want to gift a Nintendo-themed toy like the LEGO Super Mario World set that's perfect for a display, we've got plenty of great recommendations for you below.

  • Sonic X Shadow Generations - $29.99

Best Gifts for PlayStation Gamers

There's plenty to pick out for fans of PlayStation, especially those that currently game on a PS5 as there are dozens of great games and accessories to choose from. IGN Commerce Manager Eric Song recommends the PlayStation DualSense Controller, specifically the new Chroma Collection that features iridescent colors that shift from every angle and look great with his RGB setup.

PlayStation DualSense Controller - Chroma Collection

PlayStation's DualSense controller comes in a variety of colors to express yourself and features Adaptive Triggers and Haptic Feedback to immerse you in your gameplay.

If controllers aren't their thing, consider gifting a headset, this year's popular Black Myth: Wukong game, or any of the other recommendations below.

Best Gifts for Xbox Gamers

IGN Executive Editor of Guides and Podcast Unlocked regular Miranda Sanchez recommends the Special Edition Ghost Cipher Xbox Wireless Controller. Why? She thinks it's one of the coolest special edition controllers Xbox has ever released, and loves that you can use it with so many devices outside the Xbox ecosystem, too.

Best Gifts for PC Gamers

If you're looking for the perfect gift for a PC gamer this holiday season, you can't go wrong with picking them up some new peripherals for their rig. While I primarily play with mouse and keyboard, I do recommend having a controller for those times when you want to kick back and relax. I reviewed the Scuf Instinct Pro controller a while back, and it's still one of the best controllers I've ever used. It feels great to hold, doesn't slip while playing thanks to the textured grip, and the adjustable triggers are super snappy.

Scuf Instinct Pro Controller

This pro-grade controller features four mappable rear buttons, a comfortable grip, interchangeable thumbsticks, and instant triggers for faster response time.

Other great gifts below include a small form factor mechanical keyboard, a lightweight mouse, headphones, or some gear for the aspiring streamer in your life.

If you've made it this far and you're still not sure what to get the gamer in your life, you can always rely on a gift card and let them pick out what they want. While you shop around for others or for yourself, be sure to browse early Black Friday gaming discounts as they continue to drop. Black Friday is November 29 this year, but every day we're seeing more deals drop ahead of the big sale's event. For instance, SecretLab has an early deal happening now on Titan Evo gaming chairs, and there will be deals on other chairs (such as the GTRacing one shown below), plus desks, accessories and more.

  • GTRacing Gaming Chair - $93.99

Matthew Adler is a Commerce, Features, Guides, News, Previews, and Reviews writer for IGN. You can follow him on the site formerly known as Twitter @MatthewAdler and watch him stream on Twitch.
